name: Path N GIST Stomach
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 16 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0.

**Note 2:** Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Regional lymph nodes**

    Celiac
       Hepatic (excluding gastrohepatic) 
       Hepatoduodenal     
    Left gastric (superior gastric), NOS
       Cardial
       Cardioesophageal
       Gastric, left
       Gastropancreatic, left
       Lesser curvature
       Lesser omental
       Paracardial
    Hepatoduodenal (for lesser curvature)  
    Nodule(s) in perigastric fat    
    Pancreaticosplenic (pancreaticolienal)
    Pancreaticoduodenal
    Perigastric, NOS
    Peripancreatic
    Right gastric (inferior gastric), NOS:
       Gastrocolic
       Gastroduodenal
       Gastroepiploic (gastro-omental), right or NOS
       Gastrohepatic
       Greater curvature
       Greater omental
       Pyloric, NOS: infrapyloric, subpyloric, suprapyloric
    Splenic (lienal), NOS
        Gastroepiploic (gastro-omental), left
        Splenic hilar
footnotes: \# NX is not defined in AJCC 7th edition.
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed#

    Physician unable to assess N

    Involvement of regional lymph nodes not documented

Clinically: No regional lymph node metastasis
